clusters.title: US, India strike trade deal

items.title: US, India strike trade deal
items.standfirst: The US and India struck a trade deal to lower American duties on Indian goods, stabilizing the countries’ relationship after months of strain. US President Donald Trump, who had hit New Delhi with steep tariffs over its economic ties to Moscow, said Monday that India would stop buying Russian oil…
items.content: The US and India struck a trade deal to lower American duties on Indian goods, stabilizing the countries’ relationship after months of strain. US President Donald Trump, who had hit New Delhi with steep tariffs over its economic ties to Moscow, said Monday that India would stop buying Russian oil…

items.title: U.S. and India reach trade deal
items.standfirst: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday said he had agreed on a trade deal with India that slashes U.S. tariffs on Indian goods in exchange for India lowering trade barriers and halting its of purchases of Russian oil and shifting them to the United States and potentially Venezuela.
items.content: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday said he had agreed on a trade deal with India that slashes U.S. tariffs on Indian goods in exchange for India lowering trade barriers and halting its of purchases of Russian oil and shifting them to the United States and potentially Venezuela.

items.title: Trump to slash US tariffs on India from 50 percent to 18 percent
items.standfirst: Donald Trump had slapped India with a punitive 25% tariff for buying Russian oil on top of a 25% 'reciprocal' tariff.
items.content: Donald Trump had slapped India with a punitive 25% tariff for buying Russian oil on top of a 25% 'reciprocal' tariff.

items.title: Trump lowers tariffs on India, saying Modi agreed to stop buying Russian oil
items.standfirst: President Trump announced that he and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi have agreed to a trade deal that will lower tariffs and halt India's purchase of Russian oil.
items.content: President Trump announced that he and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi have agreed to a trade deal that will lower tariffs and halt India's purchase of Russian oil.

items.title: Trump says Indian prime minister agreed to stop buying Russian oil
items.standfirst: President Trump said Monday that Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has agreed to stop buying Russian oil. CBS News' Ed O'Keefe reports.
items.content: President Trump said Monday that Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has agreed to stop buying Russian oil. CBS News' Ed O'Keefe reports.

items.title: Trump to slash India tariffs after Modi ‘agrees’ to stop buying Russian oil

items.content: Levies will drop from 50% to 18% as US president claims New Delhi will buy more than $500bn of American goods

items.standfirst: US president made announcement on Truth Social after a Monday call with India’s prime ministerDonald Trump claimed India has agreed to stop buying Russian oil as he announced plans to cut US tariffs on Indian exports.The US president announced that he and the Indian prime minister, Narendra Modi, whom he proclaimed to be “one of my greatest friends”, had agreed to strike a trade deal. Continue reading...
items.content: US president made announcement on Truth Social after a Monday call with India’s prime ministerDonald Trump claimed India has agreed to stop buying Russian oil as he announced plans to cut US tariffs on Indian exports.The US president announced that he and the Indian prime minister, Narendra Modi, whom he proclaimed to be “one of my greatest friends”, had agreed to strike a trade deal. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Populist conservative Laura Fernández wins Costa Rica's presidential election
clusters.neutral_headline: Laura Fernández Wins Costa Rica Presidency

items.title: Populist conservative Laura Fernández wins Costa Rica's presidential election
items.standfirst: Candidate Laura Fernández won a resounding victory, promising to continue the aggressive reorienting of the Central American nation's politics started by her predecessor.
items.content: Candidate Laura Fernández won a resounding victory, promising to continue the aggressive reorienting of the Central American nation's politics started by her predecessor.(Image credit: Carlos Borbon)

items.title: Costa Rica: Conservative populist Laura Fernández wins presidency, preliminary results show
items.standfirst: Conservative populist Laura Fernández won Costa Rica’s presidency in a first-round victory, securing 48.3% of the vote versus 33.4% for her closest rival, Álvaro Ramos. She aims to continue the political agenda of outgoing President Rodrigo Chaves, while Ramos conceded and pledged a “constructive opposition.” Fernández’s win will be formally confirmed after a manual vote count begins Tuesday.
items.content: Conservative populist Laura Fernández won Costa Rica’s presidency in a first-round victory, securing 48.3% of the vote versus 33.4% for her closest rival, Álvaro Ramos. She aims to continue the political agenda of outgoing President Rodrigo Chaves, while Ramos conceded and pledged a “constructive opposition.” Fernández’s win will be formally confirmed after a manual vote count begins Tuesday.

items.title: Fernández wins Costa Rican presidency, steering Latin America further right
items.standfirst: Rightwing populist elected in landslide after promising to crack down on rising violence linked to cocaine tradeThe rightwing populist Laura Fernández has won Costa Rica’s presidential election in a landslide after promising to crack down on rising violence linked to the cocaine trade.Fernández’s nearest rival, centre-right economist Álvaro Ramos, conceded defeat as results showed the ruling party far exceeding the threshold of 40% needed to avoid a runoff. Continue reading...
items.content: Rightwing populist elected in landslide after promising to crack down on rising violence linked to cocaine tradeThe rightwing populist Laura Fernández has won Costa Rica’s presidential election in a landslide after promising to crack down on rising violence linked to the cocaine trade.Fernández’s nearest rival, centre-right economist Álvaro Ramos, conceded defeat as results showed the ruling party far exceeding the threshold of 40% needed to avoid a runoff. Continue reading...

items.title: Candidate tough on crime wins Costa Rica presidential election
items.standfirst: Laura Fernández won the election outright in the first round amid concern about a rise in organised crime.
items.content: Laura Fernández won the election outright in the first round amid concern about a rise in organised crime.

ai_summary: Laura Fernández wins Costa Rica's presidential election
Fernández promises to crack down on rising violence

Her nearest rival, Álvaro Ramos, concedes defeat

items.content: Marius Borg Høiby, who goes on trial on Tuesday, has been remanded in custody for four weeks after new allegations.

items.title: Son of Norway’s crown princess arrested on new charges before start of rape trial
items.standfirst: Detention of Marius Borg Høiby comes as Epstein files pile pressure on his mother, crown princess Mette-MaritThe son of Norway’s crown princess, Marius Borg Høiby, has been arrested on new charges just days before the start of his rape trial, as his mother continues to face questions over her relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.The Oslo police district said Høiby had been arrested on Sunday evening on suspicion of assault, making threats with a knife and violating a restraining order. Continue reading...
items.content: Detention of Marius Borg Høiby comes as Epstein files pile pressure on his mother, crown princess Mette-MaritThe son of Norway’s crown princess, Marius Borg Høiby, has been arrested on new charges just days before the start of his rape trial, as his mother continues to face questions over her relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.The Oslo police district said Høiby had been arrested on Sunday evening on suspicion of assault, making threats with a knife and violating a restraining order. Continue reading...

items.title: Norway’s royal crisis: Crown princess faces Epstein scrutiny ahead of son’s rape trial
items.standfirst: Norway’s Crown Princess Mette-Marit is facing mounting scrutiny after her name appeared more than a thousand times in the latest batch of released documents related to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The revelations come as the princess’ son, Marius Borg Hoiby, faces 38 criminal charges, including rape, in a trial that is due to start Tuesday. Over the weekend, Hoiby was arrested again – this time on suspicion of threats, assault and for violating a restraining order, police said.
items.content: Norway’s Crown Princess Mette-Marit is facing mounting scrutiny after her name appeared more than a thousand times in the latest batch of released documents related to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The revelations come as the princess’ son, Marius Borg Hoiby, faces 38 criminal charges, including rape, in a trial that is due to start Tuesday. Over the weekend, Hoiby was arrested again – this time on suspicion of threats, assault and for violating a restraining order, police said.

ai_summary: Son of Norway's crown princess arrested ahead of rape trial
Marius Borg Høiby faces 38 criminal charges, including rape
He is remanded in custody for 4 weeks
New allegations include assault and violating a restraining order
Crown Princess Mette-Marit faces scrutiny over Epstein links

clusters.title: Police assess reports of alleged misconduct after Mandelson emails published

items.title: Police assess reports of alleged misconduct after Mandelson emails published
items.standfirst: The peer is accused of passing on sensitive government information to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
items.content: The peer is accused of passing on sensitive government information to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

items.title: Met to review reports of alleged misconduct in public office after latest Epstein files release - as it happened
items.standfirst: Gordon Brown calls for inquiry over Peter Mandelson’s apparent disclosure of highly sensitive government information to Jeffrey EpsteinPeter Mandelson “leaked a sensitive UK government document to Jeffrey Epstein while he was business secretary that proposed £20bn of asset sales and revealed Labour’s tax policy plans”, the Financial Times is reporting.In his story, Jim Pickard says:The memo, dubbed “Business Issues”, was written on June 13 2009 by Nick Butler, who at the time was special adviser to the then prime minister Gordon Brown.The confidential document, which was released by the US Department of Justice as part of a tranche of millions of files relating to Epstein, had been sent to British government officials including cabinet secretary Jeremy Heywood.It is right that Peter Mandelson is no longer a member of the Labour party. Disciplinary action was underway prior to his resignation. Jeffrey Epstein’s heinous crimes destroyed the lives of so many women and girls, and our thoughts remain with his victims. Continue reading...
items.content: Gordon Brown calls for inquiry over Peter Mandelson’s apparent disclosure of highly sensitive government information to Jeffrey EpsteinPeter Mandelson “leaked a sensitive UK government document to Jeffrey Epstein while he was business secretary that proposed £20bn of asset sales and revealed Labour’s tax policy plans”, the Financial Times is reporting.In his story, Jim Pickard says:The memo, dubbed “Business Issues”, was written on June 13 2009 by Nick Butler, who at the time was special adviser to the then prime minister Gordon Brown.The confidential document, which was released by the US Department of Justice as part of a tranche of millions of files relating to Epstein, had been sent to British government officials including cabinet secretary Jeremy Heywood.It is right that Peter Mandelson is no longer a member of the Labour party. Disciplinary action was underway prior to his resignation. Jeffrey Epstein’s heinous crimes destroyed the lives of so many women and girls, and our thoughts remain with his victims. Continue reading...

items.title: Mandelson could face police inquiry over alleged leak to Epstein
items.standfirst: Met police assessing reports of alleged misconduct in public office after government information apparently sharedPeter Mandelson is facing a possible police investigation into his alleged leak of market-sensitive information to Jeffrey Epstein at the height of the financial crisis.New disclosures from the Epstein files appear to show Mandelson sent a string of emails to the late sex offender containing confidential information that the government was receiving to deal with the global crash while he was business secretary under Gordon Brown.A confidential UK government document outlining £20bn in asset sales.Mandelson claiming he was “trying hard” to change government policy on bankers’ bonuses.An imminent bailout package for the euro the day before it was announced in 2010.A suggestion that the JPMorgan boss “mildly threaten” the chancellor. Continue reading...
items.content: Met police assessing reports of alleged misconduct in public office after government information apparently sharedPeter Mandelson is facing a possible police investigation into his alleged leak of market-sensitive information to Jeffrey Epstein at the height of the financial crisis.New disclosures from the Epstein files appear to show Mandelson sent a string of emails to the late sex offender containing confidential information that the government was receiving to deal with the global crash while he was business secretary under Gordon Brown.A confidential UK government document outlining £20bn in asset sales.Mandelson claiming he was “trying hard” to change government policy on bankers’ bonuses.An imminent bailout package for the euro the day before it was announced in 2010.A suggestion that the JPMorgan boss “mildly threaten” the chancellor. Continue reading...

items.content: Metropolitan Police announces move after revelations former minister leaked confidential information to sex offender

clusters.title: Virginia man having affair with au pair found guilty of murdering wife and another man
clusters.neutral_headline: Virginia Man Found Guilty of Murder

items.title: Virginia man having affair with au pair found guilty of murdering wife and another man
items.standfirst: Prosecutors say other man was lured to Brendan Banfield’s house as a fall guy in scheme to get rid of Banfield’s wifeA Virginia man having an affair with the family’s Brazilian au pair was found guilty Monday of murdering his wife and another man that prosecutors say was lured to the house as a fall guy.Brendan Banfield, a former IRS law enforcement officer, told police he came across Joseph Ryan attacking his wife, Christine Banfield, with a knife on the morning of 24 February 2023. He shot Ryan and then Juliana Magalhães, the au pair, shot him, too. Continue reading...

He shot Ryan and then Juliana Magalhães, the au pair, shot him, too. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Syria security forces enter strategic al-Hassakeh as part of deal with Kurdish-led SDF

items.title: Syria security forces enter strategic al-Hassakeh as part of deal with Kurdish-led SDF
items.standfirst: Forces reporting to Syria’s interior ministry on Monday entered the strategic city of al-Hassakeh in the northeast as part of an agreement with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF). Under the deal, the security forces were given permission to enter two Kurdish-controlled cities in exchange for integrating SDF and its administration into the central government.
items.content: Forces reporting to Syria’s interior ministry on Monday entered the strategic city of al-Hassakeh in the northeast as part of an agreement with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF). Under the deal, the security forces were given permission to enter two Kurdish-controlled cities in exchange for integrating SDF and its administration into the central government.

items.standfirst: British Medical Association members back further action as union’s chair says ‘a deal is there to be done’Resident doctors in England have voted to strike for another six months in their long-running jobs and pay dispute with the government.Their decision means that, unless an agreement emerges, the campaign of strikes by resident – formerly junior – doctors will enter its fourth year, as the industrial action began in March 2023. items.standfirst: Fifa president Gianni Infantino apologises for controversial comments he made about British football supporters which were criticised by fan groups.
items.content: Fifa president Gianni Infantino apologises for controversial comments he made about British football supporters which were criticised by fan groups.

items.title: World football chief issues apology to British fans after 'cheap joke'
items.standfirst: The president of world football's governing body FIFA has apologised to British football fans after a comment which was criticised as a "cheap joke" by the Football Supporters' Association.
items.content: The president of world football's governing body FIFA has apologised to British football fans after a comment which was criticised as a "cheap joke" by the Football Supporters' Association.

ai_summary: Fifa president Gianni Infantino apologizes for comments
Comments were criticized by fan groups as a joke
Infantino made comments about British football supporters
Football Supporters' Association called it a cheap joke
Infantino issues apology to British football fans
